instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S2: What is PP3V3_S2? PP3V3_S2 is a typo of PP3V3_S3.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v stuck
threads.message:
Hi this is a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in 5.14v looping 0 - 0.08amps on both usb ports
No power on from battery
No DFU MODE


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> = 11.7v-12.15v
<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON_VDDMAIN</SIGNAL> =3.73v-3.76v
When remove F5200 in <CAPACITOR>C5254</CAPACITOR> i get steady 12.20v

Diode mode
<SIGNAL>PP5V2_S2</SIGNAL>= 0.2v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2</SIGNAL>=0.44v
<SIGNAL>PP1V25_S2</SIGNAL>=0.29v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v stuck
threads.message:
0.026 looks good; value varies, depending of SSD capacity.

<CHIP>U7700</CHIP>/8100 LDOs are pulsing too?
You may have problems with one of them, or even <CHIP>U5700</CHIP>.

Any history available?

BTW, forget the "V" after a diode mode reading.
Avoid a confusion with voltage reading.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v stuck
threads.message:
No history available 
Chequing again <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> i notice a short in <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_UPC</SIGNAL>
So i gon to inject 1v here and see if anything get hot
